page.title: 01Buxton, Derbyshire:Summary.
page.content: We are quite aware in Buxton of the historic thermal springs which give out water heated under the ground to a temperature of 28 degrees Celsius. We know because we have tasted the water from the fountain in The Crescent, Buxton. We've seen people there collecting samples of the water in plastic bottles. We know Buxton is still important to the tourist, because we see and hear them during the short Buxton summer. We know that it's often cloudy and wet in Buxton and this summer of 1985 has been no exception. We know that Spring Gardens with its busy shops is familiar to most visitors to Buxton, but we feel that other areas of the town will be much less known, such as{Fairfield, {Brown Edge, Corbar, Burbage,}and { {Higher Buxton. { }
